displaytitle: Perseus Displays the Gorgon's Head, from the Facade Fresco of the Palazzo del Bufalo, Rome; verso: Male Head, Arm and Other Sketches
medium: Pen and brush, brown ink and brown wash heightened with white and orange on Perseus, and supplemented with black chalk, on green
creditline: Gift of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895
inscribed: l.r.: Polidoro, in brush and ink of drawing

displaymaker: after Polidoro Caldara, called Polidoro da Caravaggio, Italian, 1499 - 1543
caption: After Polidoro Caldara, called Polidoro da Caravaggio (Italian, 1499 - 1543), Perseus Displays the Gorgon's Head, from the Facade Fresco of the Palazzo del Bufalo, Rome; verso: Male Head, Arm and Other Sketches. Pen and brush, brown ink and brown wash heightened with white and orange on Perseus, and supplemented with black chalk, on green; 19 x 35.9 cm. Gift of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895 (x1948-664)
